column16:
Need a “Patient Proxy” tied to a resource bundle – to support FHIR clients organizing records from a healthcare organization. This new object needed, for instance differentiate a parent and child’s record retrieved by proxy.   A number of objects don’t : http://hl7.org/fhir/2018Sep/relatedperson.html, https://www.hl7.org/fhir/patient-definitions.html#Patient.contact    Both of these concepts don’t really represent what MU3 needs to support proxy relationships.This is probably my biggest comment – can we cover?
1)	What is an active proxy
2)	Can we code a “MU 3 Proxy” type
3)	Proxy type (Parent->Child, Child->Parent, etc.. )
column21: Changed from A-A to A-Q because it's clearly looking for a response

column16:
There lacks structure for an organization.
It would be helpful to show a parent organization or show a division name. Today KP is responding with Kaiser Permanente as an organization.
When in fact it is from KP Northwest.
So when we intermix records we have not provenance!
We should make a “division” field and make it non-optional if there is a “parent” org  
Today you need to define a nested hierarchy - “part-of”  Example: Burgers University Medical Center
    Eastern Services (prov)
        Emergency Dept
        Oncology Dept
column17: There lacks structure for an organization.

column14: AllergyIntolerance.clinicalStatus SHALL be present if verificationStatus is not entered-in-error.
column16: This constraint is problematic in the event that the allergy was communicated in a means besides FHIR (entered directly into a system, HL7 message, etc. It would mean that this allergyIntolerance cannot be communicated if the current status is unknown. This could be problematic, especially in the case of a severe allergy. This constraint should be removed.
The Condition category is really open ended and therefore difficult to use across systems. It is not clear what this is meant to portray. Suggest adding more clarity.

For example, service request is to provide diabetic education. patient instruction about the diabetic diet may be instructions on the nutrition order about the diabetic diet. In this case, will need to be able to reference nutrition order. Diabetic diet instructions may be educational material which could be DocumentReference.

column14: The definition of an AllergyIntolerance is that it contains information about "Risk of harmful or undesirable, physiological response which is unique to an individual and associated with exposure to a substance" If the value of the 'verificationStatus' element is set to entered-in-error, the entire resource does not actually contain valid information about any risk of exposure, and is is not safe for applications to ignore this element.

column16: This IG (Comment 68) should provide a way to provide a clear mapping between CDS Hooks constructs and FHIR Resources.  For instance, it should provide the proper mappings between the CDS Hooks Request prefetch resources and PlanDefinition.action.input DataRequirements.  Similarly, a clear mapping specification should be provided for the mapping of the CDS Response to GuidanceResponse/RequestGroup.
column17: Provide guidance on mapping between CDS Hooks constructs and FHIR resources

column16: Currently PlanDefinition does not provide a specification for the GuidanceResponse.  Yet such a specification is required when defining the path of dynamicValues in the PlanDefinition.  For instance, if the GuidanceResponse makes use of a RequestGroup, the dynamicValue.path will be different than if the GuidanceResponse makes use of a CarePlan.

column16: OrganizationAffiliation resource needs to be a reference element in the Organization resource, for it to be useful. In its current state, retrieving an Organization resource gives no indication that it has affiliations at all. A user would need to know to search against the OrganizationAffiliation endpoint.
column17: Organization.affiliation needs to be a reference to OrganizationAffiliation for the latter to be useful.

column16:
AdverseEvent.resultingCondition - inadequate and inappropriate for documenting adverse reactions associated with AdverseEvent incidents
Rationale - in very many cases an AdverseEvent incident is associated with a set of adverse reactions similar to the case of Allergy/Intolerance incidents.
Example use case - a patient with severe gingival recession requires tissue graph treatment to cover exposure root of tooth. Soft tissue graft is harvested from patient's oral cavity and attached to the graft site by sutures. A couple of days later, the patient developed intraoral itchness and swelling
The clinician needs to document the findings as adverse reactions
Eventually, the graft devitalised and failed. After further investigation, it was determined that the patient might have suffered from allergic reactions to the suture material
As there is no prior history, this will be recorded and reported eventually as an AdverseEvent incidence with associating allergic adverse reactions
Comment - very often, a resultingCondition cannot be determined at the time of assessing and documenting reactions. What can be known is a temporal relationship between the Event incidence and a set of reactions
This and many other similar use cases support the need for replacing AdverseEvent.resultingCondtion with a Choice for resultingCondition and an AdverseEvent.reaction element that references a new resource: AdverseReaction. This resource can be reused in AllergyIntolerance and other resources where appropriate
column17: AdverseEvent.resultingCondition - inadequate and inappropriate for documenting adverse reactions associated with AdverseEvent incidents

column14:
AdverseEvent.contributor:
Definition = "Parties that may or should contribute or have contributed information to the adverse event, which can consist of one or more activities …"
Short description = "Who was involved in the adverse event or the potential adverse event"
column15:
Rename element name to:
either informationContributor or informant
Change short description to: "Who contribute(s) information about the adverse event"
column16:
The short description is significantly different in meaning to the Definition.
The short description means that party/parties who contribute(s) to or responsible for causing the adverse event incidence
Based on the definition, this element is information contributor
To avoid confusion, the element should be renamed to either "informationContributor" or "informant". And the short description should be changed
column17: The short description is significantly different in meaning to the Definition.

column14: AdverseEvent.suspectedEntity
column15:
Rename element name to:
associatedEntity
Change short description to:
"The agent causing or suspected to cause the adverse event"
Change definition to:
"Describe the agent causing or suspected to cause the adverse event"
column16:
The suspectedEntity may be assessed to have casulty of "certain", in that case, it is no longer "suspected" - hence the name of this element is semantically inappropriate for meeting all scenarios
The element name and definition/description need to be changed

column14: FamilyMemberHistory.age
column16:
It is unclear what clinical utility or relevance of documenting age of family member at time the history is taken. 
The age of family member condition/disease onset and death (if the condition was the key contributor to death) are the two clinically important and relevant age values
This element should be removed from the resource as thre is no good reason for the data collection in the context of family member history
column17: What's reason for age of family member
column21:
Not related

Lloyd: The age of a person with no onset of a condition may have relevance too.  Family history isn't only about assessing risk of a specific condition.

column14: FamilyMemberHistory.deceased
column16:
Similar toFamilyMemberHistory.age, this element is only relevant if the condition is the key contributor to death of family member history
This element should be moved to under "condition" backbone element/cluster
column17: What's reason for deceasedDate of family member
column21:
Not related
Lloyd: A relative who died at a young age without ability to develop a condition may have different relevance than one who lived a long life

column14: FamilyMemberHistory.condition
column16:
This cluster/backbone element should include:
- Is condition cause of death? (Y/N)
- if yes: age at death
column21: Not related

column16:
The purpose of capturing patient's family member history is to support assessment of the patient's risk
The sturctural definition of this resources does not appear to support execution of the assessment easily
A better structue is:
FamilyMemberHistory.condtion
   .condtion.familyMember (1..*)
                     .familyMember.relaship
                                                .onset
                                                 .Is condition cause of death?
                                                        age of death
                                          .....

With this proposed structure, for any given condition (e.g. Type 2 DM, the structure supports capturing of all family members having the condition, relationship (e.g. grand parent, parent, sibling, first cousins ...etc), their age of onset, age of death ...etc being logically clustered and relative risk for patient computed
column21:
Not related

Lloyd: Assessing risk for a specific condition is not the only use.  Systems frequently capture a patient's family history independent of the assessment of any particular condition.

column14: Description = A record of a clinical assessment performed to determine what problem(s) may affect the patient and before planning the treatments or management strategies that are best to manage a patient's condition. Assessments are often 1:1 with a clinical consultation / encounter, but this varies greatly depending on the clinical workflow. This resource is called "ClinicalImpression" rather than "ClinicalAssessment" to avoid confusion with the recording of assessment tools such as Apgar score
column16:
ClinicalImpression (resource) is described as: "a record of a clinical assessment performed …"
This description/definition is at odd/semantically incompatible with the concept clinical impression
Clinical impression is a clinician's assertion/declaration of a patient's clinical state at the end of a clinical assessment

The structural definition of the ClinicalImpression as is represents a record of the clinical assessment performed and the assertion/declaration of the patient's clinical status based on the clinical assessment. As such, to lable it as ClinicalImpression is semantically inaccurate

Suggestion:
Either rename the resource to ClinicalAssessment and in the "Scope and Usage" section delcare that it should not be confused with assessment tool
Or
Redesign the resource to have the "Finding" (which should be renamed to "Impression" as the focal point, supported by evidences derived from the clinical assessment process
column17: Definition/description at odds with what clinical impression is
column21: Not related

column14:
ClinicalImpression.investigation
ClinicalInvestigation.supportingInfo
column16: It is unclear why "investigation" is required, separate to "supportingInfo", which references "Any", which can include any investigation results used to supporting clinican arriving at the clinical impression
column21:
Not related
Lloyd: Supporting info represents information considered.  Investigation represents what was produced

column14: ClinicalImpression.assessor
column16:
The name of this element is inconsistent with similar elements defined for other resources, e.g. Procedure
Suggest harmonise the naming (e.g. performer) to be consistent with other similar resources

column14:
MedicationRequest.category
Short description = Type of medication usage
Description/definition = Indicates the type of medication request (for example, where the medication is expected to be consumed or administered (i.e. inpatient or outpatient))
column16:
The description/definition suggest that this element should be renamed to "careSetting"

The "category" element should be used for differentiating whether the request is physician initiated, nurse initiated (which in some organisations required endorsement by a physician within 24-hours), nurse practitioner initiated, etc

This suggestion applies to other medication related resources
column21:
Not related

Lloyd: Care setting is only one possible aspect of categorization.  Others might include type of substance, short term vs. long term, etc.

column16:
It is not uncommon for some medications to require authorisation by either the payor or a specialist before it can be dispensed, supplied and administered
This resource needs additional structure to support this requirement:
- authorisation number
- authority (which has a choice of payor or specialist)
column21:
Not related

Lloyd: Authorization is handled via the CoverageResponse resource (which covers pre-authorizations/pre-determinations)

column14: MedicationDispesne.status
column16:
It is possible that a MedicationRequest can be rejected, e.g. in case of doctor shopping and patient obtained a scribe that was assessed to be a duplication of another
Suggest that the status value set include "rejected"
column21: Lloyd: A refusal to fill wouldn't be captured by a status on a MedicationDispense - it would be managed through Task

column16:
It is unclear whether this resource is intended to support (1) creation of medication catalogue/drug formulary, or (2) for creating medication knowledge base 
As as, this resource is a mix-bag and serves both purposes very poorly
If it is intended for (2), the structure definition needs to be redesigned to include contents such as:
* name of medication
* composition and pharmaceutical form
* clinical features including:
    - Therapeutic indications
    - Dose, preparation, and method of administration
    - Contraindications
    - Special warning and precautions for use
    - Adverse effects
    - Dose range and overdose
* Pharmacological properties, including:
    - Pharmacodynamic properties
    - Pharmacokinetic properties
    - Clinical trials
* Pharmaceutical properties, including:
    - List of excipients
    - Incompatibilities
    - Special precautions for storage and disposal
column21: Not related

column14: Description/definition (Scope and Usage section) = The Immunization resource is intended to cover the recording of current and historical administration of vaccines to patients across all healthcare disciplines in all care settings and all regions
column16:
Administration of vaccine (or a record of), which according to the scope and usage description, is not dlinically and semantically equivalent of immunsiation.
Immunisation refers to becoming immune to certain disease(s) against which the person has been vaccinated (received vaccine administration)
It is well established clinically that seroconversion and seroprotection rates after vaccinations vary between different populations (e.g. the young vs the elderly) and for different types of vaccines
This resource (and other related) should be renamed to "vaccination"
column17: Vaccine administration is not the same as immunization
column21: Not related

column14:
Immunization.isSubpotent:
Indication if a dose is considered to be subpotent. By default, a dose should be considered to be potent

Immunization.subpotentReason:
Reason why a dose is considered to be subpotent
column15:
Suggest change definition/description to:
"Indicate a subpotent vaccine was administered. A vaccine dose given may be discovered after the fact as subpotent due to cold chain breach or product recall"
column16:
The description/definition for these two elements leads reader to interprete that a subpotent vaccine might have knowingly been administered
It is assumed that these two elements are use in retrsopective documentation when scenarios such as discovery of cold chain breach or product recall due to subpotent batch was known

Suggest change definition/description

Missing Immunization.doseNumber
doseNumber is included in ImmunizationEvaluation resource but not in Immunization resource
This is an important requirement as the vaccination record should contain information about dose number administered (e.g. dose 2 of 3 of hepatitis B vaccine)
If this information is not included in Immunization resource, how can ImmunizationEvaluation know whether the vaccination schedule is complete?

column14: Immunization.immunizationEvent (1..1)
column16:
The cardinality should be 1..*
For example, hep B vaccination requires 3 doses to complete, all three vaccincation records need to be referenced
column21: Not related

column14:
ImmunizationRecommendation.recommendation.forecastStatus:
Indicates the patient status with respect to the path to immunity for the target disease

ImmunizationRecommendation.recommendation.forecastReason:
The reason for the assigned forecast status
column15:
Suggestion:
(1) Create a new "statusEvaluation" cluster or backbone element for these two data elements
(2) Rename them to: evaluatedStatus and evaluatedStatusReason
(3) change definition to: indicate assessed status of patient's vaccination, e.g. due, overdue, complete
column16:
Element names and definition/description names are extremely confusing. If readers do not navigate to the value set example codes (due, overdue, immune, contraindicated, complete), the reader is completely at lost regarding what these elements are and their intended use

Suggestion:
(1) Given the value set, these two elements do not below to the Recommendation cluster/backbone element. They should form a separate cluster - "statusEvaluation"
(2) The element names and definition need to be improved
column21: Not related

column14:
ServiceRequest.status
ServiceRequest.intent
column15:
ServiceRequest.lifecycleStatus = the state of the service request throug its lifecycle

ServiceRequest.workflowStatus = the progression of the service request through the business/clinical workflow
column16:
These two elements represent status of a request lifecylce and status of a request workflow
Suggest that they are changed to reflect what these two elements are actually use to provide clarity and a best-practice pattern for other resources to follow

Suggested changes:
(1) ServiceRequest.status -> ServiceRequest.requestLifeCycleStatus (or simpler: .lifeCycleStatus) with the following values:
active | suspended | completed | entered-in-error | cancelled
(2) ServiceRequest.intent -> .workflowStatus, with the following values:
proposal | plan | draft | order | under review
column21:
Not related

Lloyd: Intent is not a status.  It is an immutable characteristic of the resource instance.  Naming is consistent across all resources.  Naming convention is to keep things short.
